page.title: 13Interviews (3)
page.content: Mr and Mrs Field run the village Post Office. Although they live in one of the neighbouring villages they have become part of Hornby. They provide an important service for which many of the villagers are grateful; particularly the elderly, those with very young children and those without transport. The next Post Office is 7 km away. Because of the nature of their work they are often the first to know of new arrivals to, and departures from, the village. The Post Office is one of the focal points of the village and much news is exchanged here. Hornby sees many tourists passing through but of those who stop quite a few call in at the Post Office, either to buy post cards, refreshments,etc. or to obtain information concerning routes, local events, accomodation and so on.
